intro: Daucus australis, commonly known as the southern parsley, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Its small white or yellowish flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Daucus australis is also valued for its aromatic foliage, which can be used in culinary applications.
